headline: Nucor forecasts first-quarter profit below estimates on lower steel pricing
summary: On an adjusted basis, the Charlotte, North Carolina-based company expects first-quarter earnings to be in the range of 50 cents to 60 cents per share, compared with analysts' estimate of $1.09 per share, according to data compiled by LSEG.  Nucor, with facilities in the U.S., Canada and Mexico, expects the earnings in its larger steel mills segment to be in line with the previous quarter.  However, it forecasts a sequential decline in earnings in its steel products segment due to lower average selling prices.

headline: Trump Trade: Reciprocal tariffs still to start on April 2
